name: Neil

projects.title: pls-changeset-me
projects.description: A script that will plead for you to write changesets for your changes.

aboutpara: I'm a software engineer with a passion for things that move. I have worked closely with Product teams throughout the mobility industry to deliver rich end-user experiences using embedded technology, and crafted big-data platforms which process millions of records per day. I am currently working as a Senior Software Engineer at Lacuna Technologies, where I am responsible for the Billing Platform, and one of the primary contributors to the OMF MDS New Modes workstream. I am also a maintainer of mds-core, an open source project which provides a reference implementation of the MDS specification. I attended Boston University briefly, where I was a Computer Science BA candidate before I left in strong academic standing following my sophomore year to persue career opportunities.

bullets: Technical leadership for integration of new modes of transportation in Lacunaâ€™s stack and the OMF MDS.
Built mobile applications to demonstrate the functionality of the core platform in SwiftUI
Utilized experimental NodeJS multithreading to compute a suite of analytics in 3 days which was expected to take ~4.5 months to complete prior to optimization.
Worked with Client Services team to design & implement internal admin tooling to optimize new client onboarding & support.
Languages/technologies used: Typescript Node.js, Kubernetes, Redis, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Kafka, HTTP/REST, Swift/SwiftUI
Provided technical support for LADOT regarding technical compliance of providers operating under the LADOT Dockless Mobility Program.
Authored the MDS Stops endpoints for the Provider and Agency APIs, and implemented them in mds-core.

Co-Authored the initial MDS Compliance and Policy APIs, and implemented them for the City of Los Angeles LADOT in mds-core.
Languages/technologies used: Javascript/Typescript on Node.js,  AWS Lambda, Redis, PostgreSQL, HTTP/REST.
Primary maintainer for production firmware in Zipcar and LocalMotion by Zipcar fleets.
Languages/technologies used: Java, C/C++, HTML/CSS/JavaScript, NXP Chips, PIC Chips, STM Chips.
Lead developer for a proprietary Telematics Unit emulator, designed multiple open source MPLab X plugins in Java hosted on the Zipcar Github.
Developed a collection of external components mimicking standard peripheral behavior (modem, eFlash, etc) written in Go.
Wrote firmware used in LocalMotion by Zipcar and Zipcar fleets.
Languages/technologies used: Java, C/C++, Go, HTML/CSS/JavaScript, NXP Chips, PIC Chips.
Collaborated with the Zipcar Telematics team to test production software, firmware and hardware in an Agile Sprint development environment
Shaped QE processes for the Software Engineering team
Languages/technologies used: Testlink, Testrails, Atlassian Suite
Developed cross-platform configuration tool for the Shadowbase product targeted at Oracle databases
Languages/technologies used: C#, HTML/CSS/JavaScript, Node.js, Electron.

education.universityPara: Compute Science BA Candidate. elevant Coursework: Computer Systems, Combinatoric Structures, Geometric Algorithms, Probability in Computing, Concepts of Programming Languages, Introduction to Analysis of Algorithms. Left in strong academic standing to pursue professional opportunities.
